body.body: Fix lymph node frozen sections with acetone for 15 min at room temperature.
Wash the sections with PBS 3 times and treated with the following enzymes.

Incubate the fixed lymph node frozen sections with 100 mU/ml N-glycosidase F in 10 mM HEPES-NaOH, pH 7.4, 0.1% Triton X-100, 0.1 M 2-mercaptoethanol and complete protease inhibitor \(Roche) at 37°C for 2 h.  Proceed to 6.

body: Incubate the sections with 0.1 ~ 1 mg/ml O-sialoglycoprotein endopeptidase<sup>1</sup> for in 10 mM HEPES-NaOH, pH 7.4 at 37°C for 2 h \(ref.

body.body: Incubate the sections with 25 mU/ml Heparitinase I and II and heparinase in PBS containing 1 mg/ml BSA, 1 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub> and the protease inhibitor at 37 °C for 2 h. Proceed to 6.
The digested sections were washed with PBS containing 0.1 mg/ml BSA at least 3 times and subjected to further staining.

Stanadard immunostaining technique using antibodies specific for appropriate glycans can be done to evaluate the digestions.  Lectin staining including L/E/P-selectin-IgM staining may be also applicable<sup>2</sup>.
